greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of rank k of permutations of {1,2,...,n}.
comment: The rank k of a permutation of n elements is the first position of a fixed point. If there is no fixed point then k=n+1 and R(n,n+1)=A000166(n), the derangements numbers (subfactorials).
reference: Ch. A. Charalambides, Enumerative Combinatorics, Chapman & Hall/CRC, Boca Raton, Florida, 2002, p. 176, Table 5.3 (without row n=0 and column k=1), p. 185.
link: W. Lang, First 10 rows and more.
formula: R(n,k)=0 if n+1<k, R(n,n+1)=D(n),n>=0, with D(n):=A000166(n) the derangements numbers (subfactorials), R(n,k)=sum((-1)^j*binomial(k-1,j)*(n-j-1)!,j=0..k-1), k from 1,..,n.
Subtriangle without diagonal k=n+1: R(n,k)=sum(binomial(n-k,j)*D(k+j-1),j=0..n-k), k=1,...,n, n>=1, with D(n):=A000166(n).
example: R(4,2)=4 from the four rank k=2 partitions of 4 elements (3,2,1,4), (3,2,4,1), (4,2,1,3) and (4,2,3,1).
xref: Row sums n!=A000142(n). Alternating row sums A134831.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 21 2008
